intro: Tinus macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered tinus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant features compound leaves with ovate to lanceolate leaflets and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Tinus macrocalyx is adapted to Mediterranean climates and can be grown in gardens with adequate sunlight.
